title: Tim Sweeney: Fortnite, Unreal Engine, and the Future of Gaming | Lex Fridman Podcast #467

metadata.summary: In this episode, Tim Sweeney, the visionary behind Epic Games, delves into the history and future of gaming. He explores the origins of Epic Games, the development of Unreal Engine, and the groundbreaking impact of Fortnite. Sweeney shares insights into the technical advancements in graphics, the challenges of creating realistic human simulations, and the potential of the Metaverse. The conversation also touches on the economics of game development, the role of AI, and the future of digital economies, with a focus on the importance of open platforms and creator empowerment.

topClaims.text: Epic Games transformed the gaming industry with Unreal Engine, which became pivotal after its founding in 1991.
Apple's marketplace practice of charging a 30% revenue cut is an abusive obstruction to software innovation.
The Metaverse needs a programming language that is more powerful and scalable than JavaScript.

topQuotes.text: Epic Games transformed the gaming industry, but that was a big bet in 1995 that most of the effort would be on creating the gaming engine, not the game.
Apple's wielding of soft power can change a company's economics for the worse enough to deter almost any public company.
The Metaverse needs to be a composite of code and content built by millions of different people.
Humans are good, and they want to see the good in others.

topTopics.description: The role and impact of AI in gaming.

topTopics.description: Apple's App Store policies and practices.

localized.description:
Tim Sweeney is a legendary video game programmer, founder and CEO of Epic Games that created the Unreal Engine, Fortnite, Gears of War, Unreal Tournament, and many other groundbreaking and influential video games.
Thank you for listening ❤ Check out our sponsors: https://lexfridman.com/sponsors/ep467-sb
See below for timestamps, and to give feedback, submit questions, contact Lex, etc.

metadata.shortSummary: Tim Sweeney, founder of Epic Games, discusses the evolution of Unreal Engine, the success of Fortnite, and the future of gaming, including the Metaverse and the impact of AI.
